website_summaries.verdict: Inexpensive. Optically stabilized. Light. Quite sharp. Useful zoom range.

customer_reviews.title: The auto focus doesn't work & lens will NOT manual ...
customer_reviews.text: The auto focus doesn't work & lens will NOT manual focus at all! On top of that the lens I received is NOT the lens advertised! Instead of the Nikon AF-S, I got a Nikon AF-P which is not the item described.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great lens. I was a staff newspaper photojournalist for ...
customer_reviews.text: Great lens. I was a staff newspaper photojournalist for 25yrs. Im used to top notch high end quality photo equipment. This lens has performed wonderfully for me, although it's very light, and simplistic in its control. I also believe that the price has gone up because it's been discontinued (but the newer model is basically not much different). I'm glad I got it when it was less expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Noel Webley II

customer_reviews.title: Not what is advertised
customer_reviews.text: First off, the information listed on Amazon says that you are getting a new product. I most definitely got a used product. When I tried to put it on my Camera it doesn’t even recognize it on my Nikon. It says lens not attached. It would not work at all
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Not up to standards
customer_reviews.text: The lens looked great but it was only sharp in the center, the rest of the image was horribly fuzzy and distorted. I've created award winning IR images with the same lens and this was a poor version of the lens that should not have been on the market. I've purchased used and renewed lenses on Amazon before, I've never been this disappointed in one.
customer_reviews.author: World Famous Steve Troletti™

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little lense!
customer_reviews.text: We've had our Nikon for 10 years, and it's been at all of our family's special moments. The original lense finally broke after all this time, so we were able to find this replacement. It's works just like the other one. I highly recommend this lense.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Daffern

customer_reviews.title: Excellent replacement for original lens.
customer_reviews.text: All of a sudden my original 18-55 lens that I received with my Nikon D3200 would not autofocus. I tried cleaning around the edges with no luck. I searched for a replacement and found this one for a little over $100.00. Received it today and connected to my camera. I am back in business! This lens is a little smaller than the original but works perfectly. It was listed as refurbished but looks brand new!
customer_reviews.author: Whodey

customer_reviews.title: More than worth the cost.
customer_reviews.text: Argh! I dropped my camera and my kit lens won't zoom or focus!!! I have a Nikon D80, and this is the logical replacement for my broken kit lens. The great thing is the original kit didn't have VR (Vibration Reduction) and this does. So... do I give it a 5 for being a great deal on a good kit lens, or a 4 because it's only a good lens verses a great lens? I rated this as a 4 because the optics or only good, not great, but at 1/5th (or Less) to the cost of a lens with great optics, most people are going to be happy this lens.
customer_reviews.author: D. Cameron Calkins

customer_reviews.title: Great all around lens
customer_reviews.text: I just got this lens yesterday so haven only had a day to play with it but it is perfect for what I need. I was looking to replace the lens that came with my camera and this one is a great all around lens, especially for the price. Pictures are crisp and autofocus works great on my Nikon D3100
customer_reviews.author: Bryce Williams

customer_reviews.title: Not as described - will send it back
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT what is advertised. I wanted AF-S, the same as the original which I damaged when I dropped the camera. IT is NOT AF-S. They shipped AF-P, which is a newer and cheaper lens that works OK with a D5300 but not a D5200, which I what I have. (Thanks Nikon - my next camera will NOT be a Nikon). The picture on Amazon has the wrong picture. It shows AF-S.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Perfection!!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfection. Was looking to replace a lease exactly like this one that was broken. This one was not new but there was no way to tell by looking at it or using it. Great product for 1/2 the price of a new one!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Surprised so far
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't sure this would work with my Nikon D40. It does. Even the VR seems to be great. The original lens I had finally broke all to heck, so this was a Godsend - better lens and at a deal-of-a-price. Hopefully this will manage to not fall apart like both the original lenses did, through normal use.
customer_reviews.author: Bill L. Behrendt

customer_reviews.title: Good lense for a decent price....(well it is a nikkor of course)
customer_reviews.text: I use this lense as a short range to mid range shooting system on both my D7000 and D300s. It performs like you would expect the Nikkor Lense would..perfectly...the weight is managable and the photos are crisp and clear..the auto focus is almost soundless and the VR makes it good for when I am rushing a from a bad angle (you know that one, almost upside down and cranked over trying to hold the camera steady with one hand while the other one grips onto a pole...yeah, that one).. For the price...you cant go wrong for a good workhorse lense..
customer_reviews.author: avid photo 4444

customer_reviews.title: Great lens, but it had been repackaged
customer_reviews.text: When I bought this lens it was advertised as factory fresh. But it was definitely, at best, an open box item. The box had been mangled, all inside packaging was replaced, no manual, and no warranty card. The lens was undamaged and the repackaging included silica gel moisture absorbent. I have used the lens on several occasions and it works great, much better in low light than very good original lens that came with my D40. It focuses faster and produces an even better quality photo. The price reflects an open box item, just wish that had been said up front. Any warranty is through Ace Photo Digital only, not Nikon.
customer_reviews.author: GE Moore

customer_reviews.title: Dead upon Arrival
customer_reviews.text: I received this item in a bag, not a box. When i went to use it on my d3400, it did not work at all. would focus at 18mm.... any other mm it wouldn't snap a picture. The image quality is weak as well. I returned it asap. I decided to go with a af-p lens
customer_reviews.author: Willbur2k11

customer_reviews.title: Excellant Lens from Nikon
customer_reviews.text: When my grandson received a Nikon D-80 he found the lens that came with the camera did not permit close up or wide angle shots. The lens was great for distance and telephoto. I gave him this lens and he was most pleased. The lens works great and now he can take those wide angle shots. Great product well engineered. The rings on the lens work "silk smooth".I am not qualified to go into all the various aspects of a lens and I would just be providing words I really would not know what they mean. The digital pictures are great and the easy use of the lens is just what my grandson wanted. That makes two of well pleased,
customer_reviews.author: Bill A. Belt

customer_reviews.title: Nikon? You Can't go wrong!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know quite what to say about this because I bought it for my daughter and grandsons. I have two Nikon bodies, one for film, and one digital. I had wanted to buy them some older equipment so they would learn how to use various light meters, and other things one should know, especially about composition, but I couldn't find anything. However with a film body & the camera set on "manual" one can do the same thing. This is the difference between snapshots and real photography.
customer_reviews.author: Jerlaw

customer_reviews.title: Nikon 18-55mm lens from KEH
customer_reviews.text: Nikon 18-55mm lens from KEH. This lens will be used on a Nikon D90 that was bought as a 'body only' and didn't have a wide-to-normal lens in its kit previously. I migrated my lens collection from my earlier film Nikons, but had nothing as wide angle as an 18mm. KEH shipped the same day ordered, the lens is in perfect reconditioned condition and performs perfectly (Advertised as condition = Used: Good). It is entirely spotless, and in new condition. It arrived well packaged and extremely quickly. I recommend this seller.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel A. Nicholls

customer_reviews.title: Be Aware that it is an Open Box Item!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The product is fantastic. One star off is because the description never mentioned it is an open box item, which you can consider as grey market item. Mine is from China with a Warranty Card in Chinese. For a starter, this is the only lens you need, no matter what nikon body you are using. Don't fall into the marketing crap. When it comes to art, it is always your skills not your equipment unless you are a collector. I am on D7000, and I love this combo even it seems unbalanced weight-wise.
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: High Nikon quality continues even in inexpensives lenses
customer_reviews.text: Nikon"s 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6G AF-S DX VR Nikkor Zoom Lens provides amazing image quality at a very reasonable price. The image is sharp across the entire zoom range. Auto focusing is both quick and quiet. Thanks to the use of strong and rigid plastics, the 18-55mm zoom seems to weigh almost nothing and half way through the day you won't feel like the camera strap around your neck is pulling you toward the ground. This is the lens you'll keep on your camera for most picture taking.
customer_reviews.author: Den

customer_reviews.title: Great kit lens
customer_reviews.text: Versatile kit lens. I plan on buying the 55-200mm as well so I can have the full zoom range of the 18-200mm (which I will admit I still rent for shooting concerts, but can't imagine carrying it around all the time). This 18-55 is a great wide angle zoom lens that is good for shooting outside, nighttime photography (no flash), and shooting with a flash. I found it challenging in low light conditions and resorted to using my 1.8 35 and 50mm lens when I didn't have a flash. It's great for shooting architecture, especially with a tripod. Considering it's price point everyone should have this lens.
customer_reviews.author: Ericka James

customer_reviews.title: Excellent kit lens; better than the non-VR version
customer_reviews.text: This lens is great for the price (Nikon sells it for under $100 as part of a kit). It is quite sharp at all focal lengths. The VR adds at least a stop or so to your handholding capabilities. (Note that VR usually helps more for telephoto lenses, and this one only goes up to 55m.) The image quality is superior to the non-DX version, as per my testing. It focuses very close, and is light as a feather (as lenses go). This is the lens I grab if I want a light setup with a prosumer DSLR like D5100. If you have the non-VR version, sell it and buy this one for a little bit more.
customer_reviews.author: S. Arora

customer_reviews.title: affordable beginner lens
customer_reviews.text: i'm still learning to use my new camera, so i have nothing to compare this lens to. so far so good to me, especially since i've just recently switched from a point and shoot. you can add filters to do macro shots, or wide angle shots, etc so it's pretty versatile. the zoom is about what i expected, it's not bad, but my next lens will be a telephoto zoom lens to get those far away shots. i still give it 5 stars b/c it is as advertised - a beginner, kit, 18-55mm lens at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: laurencg

customer_reviews.title: Camera lens
customer_reviews.text: Upon arrival this lens was in excellent condition, (new looking)
customer_reviews.author: Profiler

customer_reviews.title: Execellent, and useful lens
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes, when I don't want to carry a bunch of lenses, I put this one on the D80, and leave everything else in the motel. Didn't think I needed the image stabilization that much, then went on a long narrow gauge steam trail ride, through a beautiful mountain pass, when the leaves were changing. A tripod doesn't help you much, when the floor is bouncing up and down, but the VR works wonders. Some complain about the plastic construction, but I like the light weight.
customer_reviews.author: HR

customer_reviews.title: My favorite Nikon lens
customer_reviews.text: I've had this lens on my last couple Nikon cameras, and had the occasion to demo the 18-55 VRII model that comes on newer Nikons like the D5300. I prefer this one for a couple reasons. The newer VRII is smaller and more compact, and has a button that locks in the lens during transport. I don't like either of these features. This good old model just feels and functions more solidly. Can't go wrong with this workhorse lens!
customer_reviews.author: Mark David Zahn

customer_reviews.title: Nikon 18-55 lens
customer_reviews.text: I lost my lens that came with the camera and had to purchase a new one. . I accidentally bought the wrong lens but this one works great with my camera.
customer_reviews.author: kat03271960

customer_reviews.title: Did not work.
customer_reviews.text: I have a nikon d3000 and this lens did not work on my camera. When it was considered "attached" it did not auto focus and when I took it off to try reattaching it, my camera said "lens not attached" so clearly This lens is not compatible for all nikon dslr cameras. They did however refund me full price (minus shipping)
customer_reviews.author: shannontes

customer_reviews.title: Replacement
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement for the same broken lens. Its stock lens for my Nikon D60. Came in good packaging and everything in good condition. Works just like normal. Not much to say about it. Only con is that the first original broke really easy when accidently drop from almost 2 feet. So that means that these are not very durable and because I had to pay a good amount to get a new one means negative stars for this product.
customer_reviews.author: sowasky

customer_reviews.title: Received lens broken
customer_reviews.text: Autofocus function isn't functioning, and they have no more in stock. I sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Tang

customer_reviews.title: Great for indoor and outdoor shoots...
customer_reviews.text: This lens is working out great for my Nikon D-50. I previously only had a 50-200 lens which made taking photos indoors very difficult. With this lens I can get inside shots that include nearly the whole room, and can still zoom in for close-ups. The image stabilization is also a big help. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: E. Sondreal

customer_reviews.title: Nikon VR lens you can't beat it.
customer_reviews.text: You can't be the (VR) vibration reduction with this lens. When I was in Tahoe I took pictures at 55 mph on the hwy and this camera to my surprise too excellent landscape pics and a great pic of the Tahoe City sign. Anyway, don't buy a Nikon lens unless it says VR. It makes it easy for beginner and intermediate photog's to take great pics.
customer_reviews.author: Sirhikesalot

customer_reviews.title: Great as new for an excellent price.
customer_reviews.text: Great item and seller. Excellent communication.Would buy again from this seller.
customer_reviews.author: jean louis denis

customer_reviews.title: Nikon Lens
customer_reviews.text: This lens replaces the non-vr lens, and it was worth it. Some say at that range, the vr isn't really an issue. It is at night, and in the hands of an older person whose hands aren't as steady as they were 4o years ago. I see no issues with this lens either. The lens yields clean/clear photos with no tinting or purple fringing. This is a really good little lens. You can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: James Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Remarkable achievement of low cost manufacturing
customer_reviews.text: I studied lens design back in the 70's. At that time, it was impossible to contemplate a mass-produced zoom lens with aspheric elements. The principles were understood, but the computing power did not exist, nor the ability to mold glass ashperics. This lens has excellent performance, light weight and vibration reduction, and is sold for the equivalent of about $20 in 1970's dollars adjusted for inflation. Remarkable achievement by Japanese optical producers.
customer_reviews.author: Doctor.Generosity

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: For just under $200 you get a pretty good lens. Its been included in Nikon camera packages for some time so its proven to work. Its nothing fancy, but for the average joe taking pictures of his family or just for fun, its works great. You have to be a real professional to tell the difference between this and a more expensive lens. Would definitely recommend this for other users.
customer_reviews.author: Maddog

customer_reviews.title: Love this Lens!
customer_reviews.text: I am using this lens with a D7000. My prior experience was with film SLRs in the 1980's and 1990's. I found that this lens provides impressive results. The lens provides very sharp and vibrantly colored images (I tend to use manual vice automatic settings on the D7000 so that I can maximize sharpness and color vibrancy). Given the price, I couldn't be more pleased! I intend to use the 18-55mm as my primary lens for out and about photography.
customer_reviews.author: mkbiii

customer_reviews.title: I was so disappointed that they were misplaced my ordered
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this lens but I received Nikon AF-S DX NIKKOR 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6G Vibration Reduction II Zoom Lens instead. I was so disappointed that they were misplaced my ordered. I am not mood to sent them back because I am so tired of it. VR II price is about $250. Thanks, I am keep it and it's save me $100 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Sian

customer_reviews.title: To replace a 17-55 for a trip
customer_reviews.text: I was going to Peru, well known for thievery, plus the fact that I intended to walk a lot and the 17-55 is definitely heavier. Anyway, the 18-55 has been sharp enough compared to its price and weight, has resisted to the treks, and since my 55-300 has been stolen during the trip, I definitely think it was a good idea to not take the 1.500$ lense... Note that compared to the 17-55, there is the VR stabilization which partially balances the lack of aperture.
customer_reviews.author: Pitouli

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Works flawlessly and at an amazing price. Arrived sooner than expected which is awesome. I am absolutely pleased. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Decent replacement lens for the price
customer_reviews.text: I searched for a replacement lens for my Nikon 5000 when the original lens broke. Most that I found were very much out of the expected price range for my intended use on construction sites. This one was much less expensive so I bought it with minimal hesitation since it was ordered through Amazon. I was not disappointed. It arrived quickly and works fine. I'll buy another from this company if this one gets "field-damaged", too!
customer_reviews.author: Inquiring Mind

customer_reviews.title: Great Lens!
customer_reviews.text: I own a D60 and I got it used, the lens was broken and I know you can replace the lens from Nikon because I wasn't the original owner. The broken lens had many problems, zoom ring getting stuck, making loud noises, not focusing right. So I just decided to get a new lens and WOW! be HUGE difference in the quality in photos. Much more sharper, more crisp. Just awesome lens. I'm very happy that I replaced this lens!
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Erwin

customer_reviews.title: these lenses break REALLY easily, especially the autofocus aspect
customer_reviews.text: works well, these lenses break REALLY easily, especially the autofocus aspect. like if you're holding the zoom part while trying to focus manually... still not sure how i did it but i definitely broke it that way. didn't manhandle it at all. oh well? past that everything works nicely
customer_reviews.author: tommyboy

customer_reviews.title: Great lens
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice lens for daily use. I am a photographer for my school's newspaper and I use this lens with my D80 on a daily basis. the VR works well, and the autofocus works nice and quick, while still being quiet. Great lens for anyone looking to take good quality pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Great lens
customer_reviews.text: Terrific lens and a great value. I'd considered both the Sigma and Nikkor 18-200mm lenses but was put off by the aberrations created by these extended focal range designs. The combination of the Nikkor 18-55mm and 55-200mm lenses works perfectly for me and I am very impressed by the sharpness of both lenses. They are quiet, focus fast and very lightweight. Plus, I saved about $400 bucks over the Nikkor 18-200mm.
customer_reviews.author: johnny1der

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy under any circumstance!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this 0 stars I would. I really needed this lens, so I purchased it, and when it came, not only was it poorly packaged, but it wasn’t even the lens that is being advertised. It doesn’t even work for my camera. Complete disaster.
customer_reviews.author: Azuree

customer_reviews.title: It works great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lens to replace my original one that got off track. Its exactly like the one that came with my Nikon D3100 and it works perfectly! I have had it for a good 2 years now and it works like a dream. Also I got a great deal for a very fair price as I got some filters to go with it. I will continue to buy from this seller for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Villacorta

customer_reviews.title: sharp, cheap, kit lens
customer_reviews.text: The good: -cheap walkaround 18-55 mm kit lens with VR -VR is decent, especially in low light for a lens of this cost -light weight -DX specific The bad: -doesn't come with hood which is sorely needed for outdoor photography as the lens is susceptible to lens flare; Nikon hood can be bought but is subpar and expensive. -iffy, cheap construction -at wide open, it's still f3.5 -forget manually focusing, doesn't even have the markings -AF drive loud and not that fast I got this refurb'd for 100 dollars from J&R. At 180 it's still a great deal. Standard fare for the low end D3000 and D5000, it's just as good on the D200/300 series.
customer_reviews.author: Land Cruiserman

customer_reviews.title: Sharper image in low light
customer_reviews.text: This is my first VR lens for my Nikon D90. Overall lens quality is excellent. The biggest improvement in my photos with this lens is the ability to get sharper pictures in low light situations. For those of you out there wondering if you should go to a VR lens my answer is yes. It will increase your confidence in low light situations.
customer_reviews.author: Raven Rider

customer_reviews.title: Great versatile lense
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic lense, it is very versatile. Perfect for my purposes of fashion product photography, I can be just a few inches from a garment and still fit it into the entire frame. With the zoom, I'm able to get extreme detail shots of stitching, which I found difficult with my other lense. Traded this in exchange for my 28mm f/2.8, it was a great decision!
customer_reviews.author: Jolie Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: Great Replacement for D3100
customer_reviews.text: Appeared brand new, not a blemish! Installed on a D3100 and works as new including auto focus! Thank guys! Great replacement!
customer_reviews.author: C. Rae Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this new lens! I'm so happy to have found it on Amazon! I can take great pics of my kids without standing so far away with my other stronger lens.
customer_reviews.author: Kriss7399

customer_reviews.title: Bullet-resistant must-have general purpose lens for your Nikon
customer_reviews.text: This lens is a MUST-HAVE if you've got the Nikon. It's the best general-purpose lens I've owned. It focuses fast for sports action, does moderately wide field of view for capturing scenery on your vacation, has good aperture control for depth of field. Nice and tough, I've banged it around on the back of the motorcycle and never had a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Tycho Aussie

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: This lens is just the standard lens for nikkon cameras, mine had broken and I needed another, this was just what I was looking for and at a decent price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect on the Nikon
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one I wore out the first lens so as you can tell I love this lens its perfect!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lens didn’t work / not refunded
customer_reviews.text: The lens did not work at all. Very disappointed. Would not focus manually or when set on auto. I sent it back close to a month ago, well within the return period, and have not been refunded.
customer_reviews.author: Eleigh

customer_reviews.title: Great buy fro the price and quality
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for one my mother-in-law ran over. The product was used but you couldn't tell it. I definitely would recommend for the price and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Pecci III

customer_reviews.title: Wrong Lens
customer_reviews.text: I ordered an AF-S lens, and received an AF-P which will not work on the camera in was intended for. I am sure it is a good lens, but it stated clearly on the ad that it was an AF-S
customer_reviews.author: K. Gwin

customer_reviews.title: A mom with a camera and I LOVE this lens!
customer_reviews.text: I am not a professional. I am just a mom and I like taking pictures of my children! With that said, I love this lens! It is on my camera all the time, and I have captured some great shots with it. If your an amateur and looking for a good deal, you found it!
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Hawk

customer_reviews.title: Convenient for travel
customer_reviews.text: My wife was looking for something a bit more portable than her kit lens 18-105mm f/3.5-5.6 AF-S DX VR ED, and this fit the bill nicely at a great price. Certainly there are higher-end models out there (for considerably more $$), but this lens provides a very good value overall.
customer_reviews.author: D. Tanner

customer_reviews.title: great shape no complaints
customer_reviews.text: On time and on budget ... great shape no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Citizen Smith

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: Nikon makes great glass. Its what they do best. this lens is no exception. the VR feature is stable and the autofocus is quick and snappy on the D50. it IS solid plastic but with a little care should last a long time. Plus its lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly the lens we needed!
customer_reviews.text: Great lens! It came exceptionally fast. We were not expecting the shipment so quick. The lens fit perfectly into my original camera, and even had its own lens back cover. We were nothing but pleased. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Flickinger

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: My daughter inherited a nicon DSLR and all it had was the telephoto lens. She was so happy to have this lens so that she could take normal pictures from normal distances. The pictures look great, she had no trouble changing lenses, and the price was reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Rawbin

customer_reviews.title: A must-have Lens!
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect lens for a lot of occasions... I use it on my Nikon D60. It is awesome. The only thing I wish, is that the f-stop was a little lower... It is extremely difficult to almost impossible for me to snap pictures of moving objects. Not a problem though, I am buying the 35mm 1.8 that comes out at the end of the month! This is a great lens though.
customer_reviews.author: Cedric Davis

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly the world's most durable lens
customer_reviews.text: The barrel of this lens came loose (wobbles a lot) after two weeks of daily use. I suspect the lens hood, which I kept on it, provided enough leverage to break the internal guides while knocking around the camera bag. Whether Nikon thinks this is covered by warranty is still TBD.
customer_reviews.author: BBEBB

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Looks like new, works like new. Couldn't be more satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: dtuck

customer_reviews.title: Good lens
customer_reviews.text: Good lens for the Nikon DSLR's. Worked perfectly out of the box and has a good range. Overall decent lens.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: For an inexpensive lens it has a lot going for it.
customer_reviews.text: I love this lens I use it on my Nikon 7000, it is very versatile. It's light and it takes portraits well yet I can use it of wide angle shots as well. For an inexpensive lens it has a lot going for it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Clarke

customer_reviews.title: great lens for the price
customer_reviews.text: this lens is great for the price. great glass, with VR to boot. only complaint is the worldwide edition. the packaging looked like it was stolen from a warehouse, and did not include normal items you would expect with a nikon lens (no instruction booklet, no lens cap, cheap packaging).
customer_reviews.author: AlexC

customer_reviews.title: What a great deal!
customer_reviews.text: I had accidentally damaged my first 18-55mm nikon lens at a concert and this was such a reasonable replacement. The lens came in excellent condition and safely packaged. The shipping turn-around was fantastic as well.
customer_reviews.author: JesseBeans

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit surprised at the sharpness of this lens. I have been very pleased with the results of this lens. Sure, it's not fast, but the image quality is nothing to be ashamed of either. For entry-level work and for teaching, I recommend this lens.
customer_reviews.author: R. Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Love it !
customer_reviews.text: Excellent replacement. Very versatile lens! Plus, it was at a price others couldn't beat; especially as a VR NIKKOR. I'm glad I went through Amazon, otherwise I'd have paid too much and it wouldn't have been warrantied.
customer_reviews.author: rickiemarie

customer_reviews.title: I did not like this lens
customer_reviews.text: I did not like this lens. The mechanism felt gritty, and the pictures were no better than with my extra-range 17-205 zoom. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mark in Santa Monica

customer_reviews.title: Not too Heavy
customer_reviews.text: This focal length works well for weddings. For years I've been using non-stabilized lenses, but I decided, since I am getting older and less steady, to buy this lens. It works fine, shooting without flash in a dark room. Nikon quality.
customer_reviews.author: Casan

customer_reviews.title: Great little lense
customer_reviews.text: Great little lense. I've had it for nearly half a year. Very light and versatile. Not a huge zoom range, but more than adequate for most of the pictures I am taking. Very good quality images.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: No issues, product arrived on time and was as described.
customer_reviews.author: Retenue

customer_reviews.title: Good overall
customer_reviews.text: Better than expected for a "refurbished unit", but it could have been brand new for all I knew. I would have docket the entire package one star only because the free tinted lens they included was the wrong size. It was a 54mm lens cover for a 52mm camera lens. Duh. But that's ok, it was free, I suppose. Very pleased with the lens and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: lostinthemix

customer_reviews.title: VR Lens
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure about a VR lens, but this one works great. I have played around with to see the difference in how slow a shutter speed you can use. It works well in lower lighting.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nikon 18-55 VR
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a nice lens. The only problem I've noticed is that it has a hard time with auto focus when used over water. An example would be an island in a lake. I have to compose with the island at the very bottom of the frame for the autofocus to stop cycling.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Gillham

customer_reviews.title: Great lens Lovin' it!
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased this lens been trying it out works very well. I keep this lens on my Nikon D80 most of the time. I also have a 70-300(non-VR) that I use for long shots on a tripod or monopod. But most of my stuff is wide angle shots and close up anyway so this works very well for that.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A.

customer_reviews.title: It's in great condition with the exception of where the lens cover ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought a used 18-55mm. It's in great condition with the exception of where the lens cover can't be put on. I found a cap from a make-up jar and, used a small wide rubber band to use to protect lens (yes, I McGuyvered it).But, for the price, it was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Underwood

customer_reviews.title: Good standard walkaround
customer_reviews.text: It's a great lens for beginners who are just figuring out what lenses they need. It's not the sharpest lens out there, but very cheap if you are buying used.
customer_reviews.author: Ramona Carbona

customer_reviews.title: Did not receive AF-S lense
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I received the AF-P lens instead of the AF-S lens in the item description. The AF-P does not work with my D3000 so I am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Just what we ordered
customer_reviews.text: Great lens. We had damaged the one that orginally came with our camera and this one fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: GB

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a Nikon zoom lens
customer_reviews.text: My husband is a big camera buff, he needed a zoom lens for those special pics. Love the Nikon lens and the price was very reasonable! He loved it and takes it everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: krisjay

customer_reviews.title: Excellent as expected
customer_reviews.text: I dropped a sticky beverage on my previous lens, so I replaced it with this one and it's great. I'm a novice at photography and I find this lens to be an optimal, standard lens. The price and warranty were pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: klove4u

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I really love this one's it does the job and takes clear photos it's fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia Niemi

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: love the size and the option of af/vr on the lens
customer_reviews.author: Arg

customer_reviews.title: Good Lens
customer_reviews.text: For so long I have been using a 55-200 mm lens for my Nikon D 80. This is the perfect addition to it. In fact I usually use this lens mainly for all applications.
customer_reviews.author: J. Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Great lens.
customer_reviews.text: This lens is great and was a good price. Have been nothing but happy with the shots I have taken with it, except of course the operator error shots :) that had nothing to do with the lens.... would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Alohaguy

customer_reviews.title: Great lens! Takes marvelous pictures with my Nikon Camera
customer_reviews.text: Great lens ! Takes marvelous pictures with my Nikon Camera.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Quality and inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: I've used my 18-55mm for about 6 months now and I really like it! It doesn't have the greatest range for zoom, but works very nice for a kit lens. I also purchased theto compliment this lens. However, I kind of wish I would have gone for the higher price and purchased the, but having said that, this lens works great especially for the lower price!
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Vigneux

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Lens
customer_reviews.text: After dropping my identical lens in the ocean, I replaced it with this one. It works great and I'd highly recommend it!...Just don't drop it in the ocean, saltwater does a number on electrical boards!
customer_reviews.author: Whocares

customer_reviews.title: The most versatile lens I have. VR= tripod collecting ...
customer_reviews.text: The most versatile lens I have. VR= tripod collecting dust in closet. I can shoot off hand in low light conditions.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Wow, this is a kit lens?
customer_reviews.text: ALl I'll say for this review is that Ken Rockwell was spot on with this lens. It is sharp sharp sharp... Don't wast your money on a faster lens, way overrated and way too expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Shinebox

customer_reviews.title: vivid definition and sturdy casing. Great addition to any lens pack
customer_reviews.text: Really smooth operation, vivid definition and sturdy casing. Great addition to any lens pack.
customer_reviews.author: Paul King

customer_reviews.title: Just Like the Kit
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement for the kit lens, which was probably ruined by a grain of sand at the beach. This one works like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: MTSOfan

customer_reviews.title: Love birding.
customer_reviews.text: watch out backyard animals....I am on your trail. I have two high range lenses, and was unable to get really tight shots of flowers, insects, etc. Now I can....what a way to see nature.
customer_reviews.author: catherine a. haley

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: My first lens broke and I was devastated. I could not find anyone to fix it. My husband bought this for me and I could not be happier. It works perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Nikon 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6G AF-S DX VR Nikkor Zoom Lens
customer_reviews.text: This Nikon 18-55mm lens was a great replacement for the original my oldest son destroyed on out last golf outing. The price was also a factor.
customer_reviews.author: JK

product_meta.title: Nikon 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6G AF-S DX VR Nikkor Zoom Lens - White Box (New) (Bulk Packaging)
product_meta.description:
Product Packaging:Standard PackagingNikon 18-55MM F3.5-5.6G DX VR (2176)

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Nikon Total Digital SLR Imaging System includes world-renowned optical quality from Nikkor lenses. Ongoing research and development of Nikkor lenses allows Nikon to continuously provide Nikon digital SLR photographers with additional choices and even greater optical performance.

 Nikon is pleased to add to the lineup the new AF-S DX-Nikkor 18-55mm f3.5-5.6G VR, a lens featuring a built-in Silent Wave Motor and Vibration Reduction (VR). The AF-S DX-Nikkor 18- 55mm f3.5-5.6G VR is an affordable, and compact, 3x zoom lens with amazing versatility. This new lens provides enhanced shooting flexibility as the latest addition to the Nikon DX-Nikkor lens lineup.

Feature and Performance Highlights 

 * 3x zoom lens covering the most frequently used focal range of 18 to 55mm (picture angle is equivalent to focal length from 27 to 82.5mm in Nikon FX or 35mm format) 
 * Vibration Reduction enables sharper pictures while shooting at shutter speeds up to three stops slower than would otherwise be possible (as determined by Nikon performance tests) 
 * Optical design, optimized for use with Nikon digital SLRs for superior performance 
 * Hybrid aspherical lens element minimizes various types of lens aberration 
 * High-performance Nikon Super Integrated Coating offers superior color reproduction while substantially reducing ghosting and flare 
 * Nikon's exclusive Silent Wave Motor ensures fast, quiet autofocus operation 
 * Rounded seven-blade diaphragm opening makes out-of-focus elements appear more natural 
 * 0.28 meter/0.9 foot closest focusing distance throughout the entire zoom range 
 * Accepts 52mm filter attachments 
 * Comfortable lens barrel features rugged construction; separate zoom and focusing rings provide the smooth operation preferred by professionals



What's in the box:
Nikon 18-55mm f3.5-5.6G AF-S DX VR Nikkor Zoom lens, LC-52 front lens cap, rear lens protector
feature_bullets: 18-55mm lens with f3.5-5.6 maximum aperture for Nikon DSLR cameras
Focal length equivalent to 27 to 82.5mm in 35mm photography
Features a Silent Wave Motor and and Vibration Reduction (VR)
0.28 meter/0.9 foot closest focusing distance throughout the entire zoom range

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars722 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
